result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Lepinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J. Lepinski in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:12 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Amended information provided to the Court by Atty Constable.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Arendt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
30 days jail with huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay $10 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Count 2 -
10 days jail to run concurrent to Count 1 with huber privileges granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay $10 fine plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel J. Lepinski
Current: 2004 County Rd G, Junction City, WI 54443 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2015)
Prior: 1540 Torun Rd #62, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Daniel J. Lepinski in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Bond Continued Defendant  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.   Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  on scheduled court dates.

Defendant Daniel J. Lepinski in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Arendt. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Waive time limits for preliminary.
Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
